article: My father and I were very close. I loved pleasing him, and he was always _ of my success. If I _ a spelling contest at school, he was on top of the _ . Later in life whenever I got a promotion, I'd call my father right away and he'd rush out to tell all his _ . In 1970, when I was _ as president of the Ford Motor Company, I don't know _ of us was more excited. Like many native Italians, my parents were very open with their _ and their love not only at home, but also in public. Most of my friends would _ hug their fathers. But I hugged and kissed my dad at every _ --nothing could have felt more _ . He was a(n) _ man who was always trying new things. He was the first person in Allentown to buy a motorcycle. _ , my father and his motorcycle didn't get along too well. He fell off it so often that he got rid of it just a month after buying it. As a result, he never again _ any vehicle with less than four wheels. Because of that motorcycle, I wasn't _ to have a bicycle when I was growing up. Whenever I wanted to ride a bike, I had to _ one from a friend. However, my father let me drive a car as soon as I _ sixteen. My father and I loved and cared about each other. We were close to each other all the time.
